alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 1:27PM PDT until further notice by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 245 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms has diminished along Black Canyon Road and Hole in the Wall Campground. Minor flooding is likely ongoing. - Hole in the Wall Campground and within washes traveling south toward Interstate 40 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Black Canyon Equestrian Campground, Hole In The Wall Campground and Mid Hills Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
